body_html:
@Joseph1977 It's in the nightly builds (e.g. tensorflow/tensorflow:nightly-gpu-py3).

@leminhtrinh
This is somewhat along the lines of what I did:

  1. docker pull tensorflow/tensorflow:nightly-gpu-py3
  2. nvidia-docker run -it -p 8888:8888 tensorflow/tensorflow:nightly-gpu-py3
  3. docker exec -it jolly_lamport bash
  4. The speech command example isn't Python 3 compatible, you'll need to fix the errors manually. I believe it's just like 4 lines of changes...

docker pull tensorflow/tensorflow:nightly-gpu-py3

docker exec -it jolly_lamport bash
The speech command example isn't Python 3 compatible, you'll need to fix the errors manually. I believe it's just like 4 lines of changes...
body:
@Joseph1977 It's in the nightly builds (e.g. `tensorflow/tensorflow:nightly-gpu-py3`).

@leminhtrinh 
This is somewhat along the lines of what I did:
1. `docker pull tensorflow/tensorflow:nightly-gpu-py3`
2. `nvidia-docker run -it -p 8888:8888 tensorflow/tensorflow:nightly-gpu-py3`
3. `docker exec -it jolly_lamport bash`
4. The speech command example isn't Python 3 compatible, you'll need to fix the errors manually. I believe it's just like 4 lines of changes...
